content:
Pasta with tomato sauce and grilled cheese sandwiches are classic comfort foods.

For desserts, I've got some simple recipes that use common ingredients you might already have at home. Here are a few ideas:

**5-Minute Fudge**

* 1 can of sweetened condensed milk
* 1 cup of chocolate chips (semi-sweet or milk chocolate)
* 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract (optional)
* Pinch of salt

Combine the sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, and vanilla extract (if using) in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 30-second intervals, stirring between each interval, until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Pour into a lined baking dish and refrigerate until set. Cut into squares and enjoy!

**Banana Bread**

* 3-4 ripe bananas, mashed
* 1 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour
* 1 tsp baking powder
* 1/2 tsp salt
* 1/4 cup of unsalted butter, melted
* 1 cup of sugar
* 2 large eggs
* 1/2 tsp vanilla extract (optional)

Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Mix the mashed bananas, flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the melted butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract (if using). Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

**No-Bake Energy Bites**

* 2 cups of rolled oats
* 1 cup of peanut butter
* 1/2 cup of honey
* 1/4 cup of chocolate chips (optional)
* Pinch of salt

In a bowl, combine the oats, peanut butter, and honey. Mix until a dough forms. If using chocolate chips, fold them into the dough. Use your hands to shape into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. Refrigerate until firm.

These desserts are all quick, easy, and use common ingredients you might already have at home. Enjoy!

Which one of these desserts catches your eye?
